Selected Answer: B
B. Review the project backlog looking for high-priority items and come up with a minimum viable product (MVP) that fits the expected timeline.

Given the new timeline of six months, it's essential to prioritize and focus on delivering the most critical features and functionalities to meet the minimum viable product (MVP) requirements. This approach allows the project to launch within the shortened timeframe while still providing value to stakeholders. Crashing, fast tracking, or increasing the budget significantly might not always be feasible or practical, so prioritizing and delivering the most valuable components of the project is a more pragmatic approach in this scenario. It's important to communicate this adjusted plan with stakeholders to manage their expectations and gain their buy-in.
